es.uvigo.esei.ephyslab.fortrananalyser

Class NoGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.uvigo.esei.ephyslab.fortrananalyser.NoGUI

  • public class NoGUI
extends Object
    This class create a NoGUI and support the logic part of the application without graphical intercface, after that it generate the quallity report.
    Version:
    1.9.2
    Author:
    Michael García Rodríguez

      • analyseUseCycle

        public boolean analyseUseCycle(String filePath)
                        throws IOException
        This method analyse the use of the CYCLE sentence in the file. It is used in loops to avoid making a certain sentence, so that it continues to iterate to the next element. With they use, the code is more efficient.
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the file analysed
        Returns:
        true in case CYCLE sentence is used
        Throws:
        IOException - in case something wrong with intput/output file

      • analyseUseExit

        public boolean analyseUseExit(String filePath)
                       throws IOException
        This method check if the EXIT sentence is used in the file. EXIT sentence is used to go out of a loop, so the code is more efficient
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the file
        Returns:
        boolean with the use or not of EXIT sentence
        Throws:
        IOException - in case something wrong with intput/output file

      • analyseNumberSubroutines

        public int analyseNumberSubroutines(String filePath)
                             throws IOException
        This method analyse the number of subroutines declared in a file
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the file analysed
        Returns:
        the number of subroutines
        Throws:
        IOException - in case something wrong with intput/output file

      • analyseNestedLoops

        public boolean analyseNestedLoops(String filePath)
                           throws IOException
        This method analyse the number of Nested loops there are. If this number is greater than 3 or smaller than 0 AND this line don't have a comment , it is consider a bad programming practice.
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the file analysed
        Returns:
        boolean with the use of nested loops
        Throws:
        IOException - in case something wrong with intput/output file

        This method count the number of declared variables in a file

        filePath - of the file analysed
        Returns:
        the number of declared variables
        Throws:

        public boolean analyseGoodCommentControlStructures(String filePath)
                                            throws IOException
        This method analyse if the Control Structures are commented: ifs and switch case
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the file analysed
        Returns:
        boolean with the result of the use of good comments
        Throws:
        IOException - in case something wrong with intput/output file

        Returns:

        Throws:

                                      throws IOException

        Returns:
        boolean with the result of the use of good comments in variables
        Throws:

      • analyseGoodCommentInitDoc

        public boolean analyseGoodCommentInitDoc(String filePath)
                                  throws IOException
        This method analyse if there is a good comment at the beginning of a file
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the file analysed
        Returns:
        boolean with the result of the use of good comments at the beginning of the document
        Throws:
        IOException - in case something wrong with intput/output file

      • analyseGoodCommentFunctions

        public boolean analyseGoodCommentFunctions(String filePath)
                                    throws IOException
        This method check if the functions delcared in a file have or not have a comment. The comment can be after or before the declaration of the function. In addition, at the end of functions there are no comments.
        Parameters:
        filePath - of the analysed file
        Returns:
        boolean with the result of the use of good comments in functions
        Throws:
        IOException - in case something wrong with intput/output file

        This method transform a time in miliseconds in days, hours, minutes and seconds
        Parameters:
        millis - the time to transform
        Returns:
        the time in days, hours, minutes and seconds
